research_mod_shield_pre.description: Live combat data will help in developing more advanced shield technology.

research_mod_ship_mk1.name: Basic Chassis Mods
research_mod_ship_mk1.description: Allows the crafting of basic chassis mods for ships.

research_mod_ship_mk2.name: Advanced Chassis Mods
research_mod_ship_mk2.description: Allows the crafting of more advanced chassis mods for ships.

research_mod_ship_mk3.name: Exceptional Chassis Mods
research_mod_ship_mk3.description: Allows the crafting of superior chassis mods for ships.

research_mod_ship_pre.name: Acquire Nanites
research_mod_ship_pre.description: Nanites will allow us to easily modify a ship chassis and bring out its potential.

research_mod_weapon_mk1.name: Basic Weapon Mods
research_mod_weapon_mk1.description: Allows the crafting of basic weapon mods for ships.

research_mod_weapon_mk2.name: Advanced Weapon Mods
research_mod_weapon_mk2.description: Allows the crafting of more advanced weapon mods for ships.

research_mod_weapon_mk3.name: Exceptional Weapon Mods
research_mod_weapon_mk3.description: Allows the crafting of superior weapon mods for ships.

research_mod_weapon_pre.name: Acquire Regulators
research_mod_weapon_pre.description: To improve the chances of creating safe and effective weapon modifications, high-spec particle regulators are required.

research_radioreceiver.name: Radio Receiver
research_radioreceiver.description: Allows you to receive radio transmissions from throughout space.

research_sensorbooster.name: Sensor Booster
research_sensorbooster.description: Allows you to scan station modules for more information.

research_teleportation.name: Teleportation
research_teleportation.description: A by-product of Terran warp research, this will allow teleportation of an individual over a limited range.

research_teleportation_range_01.name: Teleportation - Range I
research_teleportation_range_01.description: Increases the range of the personal teleporter from within 1 system to within 3.

research_teleportation_range_02.name: Teleportation - Range II
research_teleportation_range_02.description: Increases the range of the personal teleporter from within 3 systems to within 5.

research_teleportation_range_03.name: Teleportation - Range III
research_teleportation_range_03.description: Increases the range of the personal teleporter so that you can jump to ships you own across the entire Jump Gate network.

research_tradeinterface.name: Trade Interface
research_tradeinterface.description: Allows you to access trade information from around stations.

research_warp_hq_01.name: High-mass Teleportation I
research_warp_hq_01.description: Replicating the conditions often observed near spatial anomalies, enact an experiment to relocate this facility within its current sector.

research_warp_hq_02.name: High-mass Teleportation II
research_warp_hq_02.description: Allows the facility to be relocated to a marked location within any known sector.

satellite_mk1.name: Satellite
satellite_mk1.description: A static object used for observation, once deployed a satellite will pick up any communications sent and received by both ships and stations on open frequencies within a certain range. They are not one-use objects; a satellite can be deployed in one location, then deactivated and picked back up in a ship, then redeployed in a new location.

satellite_mk2.name: Advanced Satellite
satellite_mk2.description: A static object used for observation, once deployed a satellite will pick up any communications sent and received by both ships and stations on open frequencies within a certain range. They are not one-use objects; a satellite can be deployed in one location, then deactivated and picked back up in a ship, then redeployed in a new location.

scanningarrays.name: Scanning Arrays
scanningarrays.description: Scanning arrays have seen elegant redesign over the years so that ships and stations do not risk fragile antennas being broken or destroyed by collisions. Now entirely internal systems, scanning arrays are used not just in ship and station scanners and radars, but are also used in the targeting systems supplied with turret and drone components.

scrapmetal.name: Scrap Metal
scrapmetal.description: Scrap Metal has become established as a vital part of severely resource-deprived economies. Usually obtained from salvaged station segments or recovered ship wrecks, Scrap Metal can be recycled into other, more valuable, materials.

shieldcomponents.name: Shield Components
shieldcomponents.description: From generators to coils that maintain energy over time, shield components are a wide arrange of technologies that provide everything necessary to build a variety of shields. Completely modular, each part can be used in each shield, which has led to a wide variety of new-generation shields being produced in recent years. As with all ship equipment, shields are built on-demand, and so shield components are produced in factories and shipped straight to shipyards and equipment docks where they can be more freely used for construction and repair.

ship_arg_l_destroyer_01_a.name: Behemoth Vanguard
ship_arg_l_destroyer_01_a.description: The original design of the Behemoth-class destroyer was put into development mid-way through the Kha'ak conflict, during which the Titan-class was beginning to show its age and inefficiencies. At first too expensive for a crippled Argon economy, then too complex to produce quickly during the Terran Conflict, the first Behemoth did not ship out until long after that war had ended, and the Jump Gates had begun to catastrophically fail. It was only when Argon Prime and Black Hole Sun came back into contact that the Behemoth could be rolled out more frequently.

ship_arg_l_destroyer_01_b.name: Behemoth Sentinel
ship_arg_l_destroyer_01_b.description: The original design of the Behemoth-class destroyer was put into development mid-way through the Kha'ak conflict, during which the Titan-class was beginning to show its age and inefficiencies. At first too expensive for a crippled Argon economy, then too complex to produce quickly during the Terran Conflict, the first Behemoth did not ship out until long after that war had ended, and the Jump Gates had begun to catastrophically fail. It was only when Argon Prime and Black Hole Sun came back into contact that the Behemoth could be rolled out more frequently.

ship_arg_l_miner_liquid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Magnetar \ Vanguard
ship_arg_l_miner_liquid_01_a.description: As the trend towards collecting natural resources with ships continued, the inefficiencies of the solution started to become clear. While a medium-sized ship had the advantage of moving quickly through mineral and gas regions, their cargo bays were simply not big enough for industrial-scale mining to be lucrative.\n\nNaturally, the Teladi stepped in to design L-sized resource collectors that could solve that problem, and the Magnetar is the Argon response to these ships; a standardised model that can be built in two variants, allowing it to support both asteroid mining and natural gas collection.

ship_arg_l_miner_liquid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Magnetar \ Sentinel
ship_arg_l_miner_liquid_01_b.description: As the trend towards collecting natural resources with ships continued, the inefficiencies of the solution started to become clear. While a medium-sized ship had the advantage of moving quickly through mineral and gas regions, their cargo bays were simply not big enough for industrial-scale mining to be lucrative.\n\nNaturally, the Teladi stepped in to design L-sized resource collectors that could solve that problem, and the Magnetar is the Argon response to these ships; a standardised model that can be built in two variants, allowing it to support both asteroid mining and natural gas collection.

ship_arg_l_miner_solid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Magnetar \ Vanguard
ship_arg_l_miner_solid_01_a.description: As the trend towards collecting natural resources with ships continued, the inefficiencies of the solution started to become clear. While a medium-sized ship had the advantage of moving quickly through mineral and gas regions, their cargo bays were simply not big enough for industrial-scale mining to be lucrative.\n\nNaturally, the Teladi stepped in to design L-sized resource collectors that could solve that problem, and the Magnetar is the Argon response to these ships; a standardised model that can be built in two variants, allowing it to support both asteroid mining and natural gas collection.

ship_arg_l_miner_solid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Magnetar \ Sentinel
ship_arg_l_miner_solid_01_b.description: As the trend towards collecting natural resources with ships continued, the inefficiencies of the solution started to become clear. While a medium-sized ship had the advantage of moving quickly through mineral and gas regions, their cargo bays were simply not big enough for industrial-scale mining to be lucrative.\n\nNaturally, the Teladi stepped in to design L-sized resource collectors that could solve that problem, and the Magnetar is the Argon response to these ships; a standardised model that can be built in two variants, allowing it to support both asteroid mining and natural gas collection.

ship_arg_l_trans_container_01_a.name: Veles Vanguard
ship_arg_l_trans_container_01_a.description: Designed and produced by the Antigone Republic after the Jump Gates began to realign, the Veles-class freighter is more compact and self-sufficient than any freighter-class ship before it; the reason why it became part of the on-going technology exchange between the Republic and their Argon Federation allies.\n\nBuilt using a highly modular design, many ship designers have taken the base Veles model and reorganised it, as well as making their own changes to the internal systems, to sell an ever-growing number of variations on the ship. However, the Veles remains a popular choice among traders and station builders.

ship_arg_l_trans_container_01_b.name: Veles Sentinel
ship_arg_l_trans_container_01_b.description: Designed and produced by the Antigone Republic after the Jump Gates began to realign, the Veles-class freighter is more compact and self-sufficient than any freighter-class ship before it; the reason why it became part of the on-going technology exchange between the Republic and their Argon Federation allies.\n\nBuilt using a highly modular design, many ship designers have taken the base Veles model and reorganised it, as well as making their own changes to the internal systems, to sell an ever-growing number of variations on the ship. However, the Veles remains a popular choice among traders and station builders.

ship_arg_l_trans_container_02_a.name: Mokosi Vanguard
ship_arg_l_trans_container_02_a.description: When Argon Federation ship designers received the blue-prints for the Veles, it was immediately recognisable as a highly modular ship, and so they began work straight away on different variations that could provide more variety and competition in a ship class that was both needed and popular throughout Argon space.\n\nOne of the first ships to come from this process was the Mokosi, designed in Black Hole Sun. Though it uses the same base chassis as the Veles, a different container configuration and tweaks to several internal systems to adapt have created a fine addition to the Argon merchant fleet.

ship_arg_l_trans_container_02_b.name: Mokosi Sentinel
ship_arg_l_trans_container_02_b.description: When Argon Federation ship designers received the blue-prints for the Veles, it was immediately recognisable as a highly modular ship, and so they began work straight away on different variations that could provide more variety and competition in a ship class that was both needed and popular throughout Argon space.\n\nOne of the first ships to come from this process was the Mokosi, designed in Black Hole Sun. Though it uses the same base chassis as the Veles, a different container configuration and tweaks to several internal systems to adapt have created a fine addition to the Argon merchant fleet.

ship_arg_l_trans_container_03_a.name: Incarcatura Vanguard
ship_arg_l_trans_container_03_a.description: Designed and produced as part of the push to revitalise the Argon economy after the Jump Gate realignment, the relatively new Incarcatura has become a popular alternative to the Veles and Mokosi design. Though there have been some concerns as to its length, that it might caught flight problems, most experts are willing to overlook these problems due to its cargo efficiency.

ship_arg_l_trans_container_03_b.name: Incarcatura Sentinel
ship_arg_l_trans_container_03_b.description: Designed and produced as part of the push to revitalise the Argon economy after the Jump Gate realignment, the relatively new Incarcatura has become a popular alternative to the Veles and Mokosi design. Though there have been some concerns as to its length, that it might caught flight problems, most experts are willing to overlook these problems due to its cargo efficiency.

ship_arg_l_trans_container_04_a.name: Shuyaku Vanguard
ship_arg_l_trans_container_04_a.description: Designed in parallel to the Incarcatura, as part of the push to rejuvenate the Argon economy, the Shuyaku-class freighter is a Sonra variant, extending the Terracorp-designed freighter's cargo bay at the cost of some manoeuvrability. The Shuyaku also marks the Hatikvah Free League's first contribution to the Argon merchant fleet, meant as an offering of good will to both the Federation and the Republic, to show that the Free League was also taking the rebuilding effort seriously.

ship_arg_l_trans_container_04_b.name: Shuyaku Sentinel
ship_arg_l_trans_container_04_b.description: Designed in parallel to the Incarcatura, as part of the push to rejuvenate the Argon economy, the Shuyaku-class freighter is a Sonra variant, extending the Terracorp-designed freighter's cargo bay at the cost of some manoeuvrability. The Shuyaku also marks the Hatikvah Free League's first contribution to the Argon merchant fleet, meant as an offering of good will to both the Federation and the Republic, to show that the Free League was also taking the rebuilding effort seriously.

ship_arg_l_trans_container_05_a.name: Sonra Vanguard
ship_arg_l_trans_container_05_a.description: Though the Sonra-class freighter was initially designed by Terracorp after the Terran Conflict, the status of development was lost with contact to Home of Light. Quite by chance, project designers were trapped in Black Hole Sun during the Jump Gate shutdown, and were able to get the blueprints of the finished ship to the Argon Federation and Antigone Republic when contact with Argon Prime and Antigone Memorial was re-established.

ship_arg_l_trans_container_05_b.name: Sonra Sentinel
ship_arg_l_trans_container_05_b.description: Though the Sonra-class freighter was initially designed by Terracorp after the Terran Conflict, the status of development was lost with contact to Home of Light. Quite by chance, project designers were trapped in Black Hole Sun during the Jump Gate shutdown, and were able to get the blueprints of the finished ship to the Argon Federation and Antigone Republic when contact with Argon Prime and Antigone Memorial was re-established.

ship_arg_m_bomber_01_a.name: Minotaur Vanguard
ship_arg_m_bomber_01_a.description: A ship that saw much upheaval behind the scenes during the Terran Conflict, when it became painfully clear to the Argon that their ships were far inferior to the Terran equivalents, the Minotaur was over the course of the conflict completely redesigned as a mobile weapons-platform, sporting heavy weapons that deal incredible amounts of damage to similarly-sized and larger, slower targets. Unfortunately, the ship was unable to be put into mass-production before crisis crippled the Argon Federation, and as a result the new Minotaur has only recently entered service.

ship_arg_m_bomber_01_b.name: Minotaur Sentinel
ship_arg_m_bomber_01_b.description: A ship that saw much upheaval behind the scenes during the Terran Conflict, when it became painfully clear to the Argon that their ships were far inferior to the Terran equivalents, the Minotaur was over the course of the conflict completely redesigned as a mobile weapons-platform, sporting heavy weapons that deal incredible amounts of damage to similarly-sized and larger, slower targets. Unfortunately, the ship was unable to be put into mass-production before crisis crippled the Argon Federation, and as a result the new Minotaur has only recently entered service.

ship_arg_m_bomber_02_a.name: Minotaur Raider
ship_arg_m_bomber_02_a.description: A ship that saw much upheaval behind the scenes during the Terran Conflict, when it became painfully clear to the Argon that their ships were far inferior to the Terran equivalents, the Minotaur was over the course of the conflict completely redesigned as a mobile weapons-platform, sporting heavy weapons that deal incredible amounts of damage to similarly-sized and larger, slower targets. Unfortunately, the ship was unable to be put into mass-production before crisis crippled the Argon Federation, and as a result the new Minotaur has only recently entered service.

ship_arg_m_frigate_01_a.name: Cerberus Vanguard
ship_arg_m_frigate_01_a.description: The first of the newly-designed M-sized support ships to reach the Federal and Republic navies, the Cerberus-class frigate is primarily designed to target and support smaller and similarly-sized vessels in a defensive capacity. Notably, the Cerberus was also the first ship of its size to support a fully-functional dock for smaller ships; a massive technical challenge for its designers. This has only made it a more popular choice of ship, and saw a new design race explode throughout the Jump Gate network as other ship designers scrambled to copy the Argons' innovative design.

ship_arg_m_frigate_01_b.name: Cerberus Sentinel
ship_arg_m_frigate_01_b.description: The first of the newly-designed M-sized support ships to reach the Federal and Republic navies, the Cerberus-class frigate is primarily designed to target and support smaller and similarly-sized vessels in a defensive capacity. Notably, the Cerberus was also the first ship of its size to support a fully-functional dock for smaller ships; a massive technical challenge for its designers. This has only made it a more popular choice of ship, and saw a new design race explode throughout the Jump Gate network as other ship designers scrambled to copy the Argons' innovative design.

ship_arg_m_miner_liquid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Sunder \ Vanguard
ship_arg_m_miner_liquid_01_a.description: Jonferco's response to the PMC's Drill design, the Sunder fulfils a similar role to its sister ship but handles gas collection instead of asteroid mining. It is fitted with a non-modular scoop that allows natural gases to be safely placed inside the ship's cargo hold. For all the gratitude received by PMC for their work in advancing asteroid mining, Jonferco's reply sent the mining community into a complete frenzy, with the possibilities for collecting, refining and utilising natural gases spurring the economy, not just in Argon space but across the entire Jump Gate network, to a brand new high.

ship_arg_m_miner_liquid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Sunder \ Sentinel
ship_arg_m_miner_liquid_01_b.description: Jonferco's response to the PMC's Drill design, the Sunder fulfils a similar role to its sister ship but handles gas collection instead of asteroid mining. It is fitted with a non-modular scoop that allows natural gases to be safely placed inside the ship's cargo hold. For all the gratitude received by PMC for their work in advancing asteroid mining, Jonferco's reply sent the mining community into a complete frenzy, with the possibilities for collecting, refining and utilising natural gases spurring the economy, not just in Argon space but across the entire Jump Gate network, to a brand new high.

ship_arg_m_miner_solid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Drill \ Vanguard
ship_arg_m_miner_solid_01_a.description: Towards the end of the last era, the Plutarch Mining Corporation called for a shift away from static station-based asteroid mining towards the far more efficient method of using ships to identify and break down asteroids and bring them to refineries in far less time than it took for a refinery to be attached to a much bigger asteroid. Though it is now different from the PMC's original design, the Drill has been in service ever since, inspiring a train of different mining ships to be released all across the old and new Jump Gate network.

ship_arg_m_miner_solid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Drill \ Sentinel
ship_arg_m_miner_solid_01_b.description: Towards the end of the last era, the Plutarch Mining Corporation called for a shift away from static station-based asteroid mining towards the far more efficient method of using ships to identify and break down asteroids and bring them to refineries in far less time than it took for a refinery to be attached to a much bigger asteroid. Though it is now different from the PMC's original design, the Drill has been in service ever since, inspiring a train of different mining ships to be released all across the old and new Jump Gate network.

ship_arg_m_trans_container_01_a.name: Mercury Vanguard
ship_arg_m_trans_container_01_a.description: The latest redesign of the Mercury-class transporter was almost purely aesthetic, with only small changes made to allow the user more modularity and modification options. Other than the aesthetic changes made to keep the model in line with latest style trends, the Mercury remains the same reliable M-sized transporter that has seen popular use across Argon space for so many years.

ship_arg_m_trans_container_01_b.name: Mercury Sentinel
ship_arg_m_trans_container_01_b.description: The latest redesign of the Mercury-class transporter was almost purely aesthetic, with only small changes made to allow the user more modularity and modification options. Other than the aesthetic changes made to keep the model in line with latest style trends, the Mercury remains the same reliable M-sized transporter that has seen popular use across Argon space for so many years.

ship_arg_m_trans_container_02_a.name: Ides Vanguard
ship_arg_m_trans_container_02_a.description: With the Argon Federation desperate to rebuild its economy after the Jump Gates realigned, the sheer number of Mercury-class transporters across Argon space became so high that the value of the popular transporter began to sink rapidly. In an attempt to correct course, the Federation released the Ides. Though they are only slightly aesthetically and technically different, and in fact the Ides is based on the Mercury model, the ship has been pushed as competition to the popular transporter; a marketing strategy that has been well met by the public, and recently allowed for the ship market to find stability.

ship_arg_m_trans_container_02_b.name: Ides Sentinel
ship_arg_m_trans_container_02_b.description: With the Argon Federation desperate to rebuild its economy after the Jump Gates realigned, the sheer number of Mercury-class transporters across Argon space became so high that the value of the popular transporter began to sink rapidly. In an attempt to correct course, the Federation released the Ides. Though they are only slightly aesthetically and technically different, and in fact the Ides is based on the Mercury model, the ship has been pushed as competition to the popular transporter; a marketing strategy that has been well met by the public, and recently allowed for the ship market to find stability.

ship_arg_s_fighter_01_a.name: Nova Vanguard
ship_arg_s_fighter_01_a.description:
Though the prototype for the new-model Nova-class fighter was in development as far back as the Terran Conflict, it failed to reach production before the Jump Gate shutdown. Its first major role was escorting Argon Federation exploratory groups sent into newly discovered or rediscovered areas of space as the Jump Gates began to realign.

The new-look Nova is a major step up in ship design, with rotatable engines that make it formidable in strafing targets of a similar size. The Nova's redesign caused considerable controversy in the piloting community, when the rear turret was abandoned in favour of increased laser energy and strafing performance.

Despite being a sound dogfighter, the Nova lacks the firepower required by full-time combatants. The Vanguard model improves the speed of the Nova. However, some pilots have suggested a portion of the upgrade budget might have been better spent on an aesthetic redesign.

ship_arg_s_fighter_01_b.name: Nova Sentinel
ship_arg_s_fighter_01_b.description:
Though the prototype for the new-model Nova-class fighter was in development as far back as the Terran Conflict, it failed to reach production before the Jump Gate shutdown. Its first major role was escorting Argon Federation exploratory groups sent into newly discovered or rediscovered areas of space as the Jump Gates began to realign.

The new-look Nova is a major step up in ship design, with rotatable engines that make it formidable in strafing targets of a similar size. The Nova's redesign caused considerable controversy in the piloting community, when the rear turret was abandoned in favour of increased laser energy and strafing performance.

Despite being a sound dogfighter, the Nova lacks the firepower required by full-time combatants. The Nova's Sentinel variant has a hardened hull, adding resilience, though this comes at a marginal cost to speed.

ship_arg_s_fighter_02_a.name: Elite Vanguard
ship_arg_s_fighter_02_a.description: Though retired from service for a long time before the Jump Gate shutdown, the push to give any advantage to the Federal and Republic fleets in their fights against the Xenon and the Holy Order of the Pontifex has seen the long-serving Elite redesigned as an interceptor.\n\nQuick in a straight line and able to fire off short bursts of fire-power before disengaging, the Elite often targets small ships and slower missiles, as well as using its speed and size, in support of the dog-fighters that are able to hold out longer under fire.

ship_arg_s_fighter_02_b.name: Elite Sentinel
ship_arg_s_fighter_02_b.description: Though retired from service for a long time before the Jump Gate shutdown, the push to give any advantage to the Federal and Republic fleets in their fights against the Xenon and the Holy Order of the Pontifex has seen the long-serving Elite redesigned as an interceptor.\n\nQuick in a straight line and able to fire off short bursts of fire-power before disengaging, the Elite often targets small ships and slower missiles, as well as using its speed and size, in support of the dog-fighters that are able to hold out longer under fire.

ship_arg_s_fighter_03_a.name: Pulsar Vanguard
ship_arg_s_fighter_03_a.description:
When the Xenon destroyed a food production facility in Antigone Memorial, the sole survivor was protein engineer Tracie Harben. Having lost her entire family, and fuelled by vengeance, she dedicated herself to the creation of tools of destruction.

Harben's most popular design is the Pulsar fighter, also known as the "Glass Cannon". A highly aggressive vessel, it prioritises armaments and speed above all else.

No-one knew the Pulsar could be even more aggressively optimised until Harben surprised observers by releasing the Vanguard model.

ship_arg_s_fighter_04_a.name: Quasar Vanguard
ship_arg_s_fighter_04_a.description: In the midst of the Terran War, the Argon Federation floundered somewhat in their ship design output. Perhaps their worst effort was the Quasar fighter, which, named after a powerful cosmic force, failed to fully live up to expectations.\n\nThe Quasar Vanguard was commissioned to breathe some useful function into the model. However, the variant has failed to achieve popularity.

ship_arg_s_heavyfighter_01_a.name: Eclipse Vanguard
ship_arg_s_heavyfighter_01_a.description: Redesigned using the same combat-ready cockpit used by the new-look Nova, the Eclipse replaces the rotatable engines with a support structure that allows it to carry more weapons - effectively sacrificing the manoeuvrability of the dog-fighter for enough fire-power to be devastating against both small- and medium-sized ships.\n\nThis sacrifice does make the ship vulnerable to more specialised dog-fighters and interceptors, but nonetheless both the Federal and Republic navy has found the new Eclipse to be a worthy addition to their fleets, with Argon ship designers once again leading the race to design ships effective for both personal and military use.

ship_arg_s_heavyfighter_01_b.name: Eclipse Sentinel
ship_arg_s_heavyfighter_01_b.description: Redesigned using the same combat-ready cockpit used by the new-look Nova, the Eclipse replaces the rotatable engines with a support structure that allows it to carry more weapons - effectively sacrificing the manoeuvrability of the dog-fighter for enough fire-power to be devastating against both small- and medium-sized ships.\n\nThis sacrifice does make the ship vulnerable to more specialised dog-fighters and interceptors, but nonetheless both the Federal and Republic navy has found the new Eclipse to be a worthy addition to their fleets, with Argon ship designers once again leading the race to design ships effective for both personal and military use.

ship_arg_s_heavyfighter_02_a.name: Eclipse Vanguard
ship_arg_s_heavyfighter_02_a.description: Redesigned using the same combat-ready cockpit used by the new-look Nova, the Eclipse replaces the rotatable engines with a support structure that allows it to carry more weapons - effectively sacrificing the manoeuvrability of the dog-fighter for enough fire-power to be devastating against both small- and medium-sized ships.\n\nThis sacrifice does make the ship vulnerable to more specialised dog-fighters and interceptors, but nonetheless both the Federal and Republic navy has found the new Eclipse to be a worthy addition to their fleets, with Argon ship designers once again leading the race to design ships effective for both personal and military use.

ship_arg_s_miner_solid_01_a.name: Courier \
ship_arg_s_miner_solid_01_a.description: After years of outcry from many a trader about the lack of a small and speedy transporter, the up and coming ship manufacturer Jinko-Tekina have supplied both the Argon Federation and Antigone Memorial with the Courier-class s-ship, designed for transporting small numbers of valuable wares across a short distance in order to limit the risk of hijacking as well as to share the load of M- and L-sized transporters that make up the rest of the Argon merchant fleet.

ship_arg_s_scout_01_a.name: Discoverer Vanguard
ship_arg_s_scout_01_a.description: Long serving as the scout and exploration ship for the Argon fleet, the Discoverer saw little re-design or overhaul until the Jump Gate shutdown. The current model, an overall improvement on the model used before the shutdown, was designed in the Antigone Republic and made available to the Argon Federation as part of an ongoing technology exchange between the two allied factions.

ship_arg_s_scout_01_b.name: Discoverer Sentinel
ship_arg_s_scout_01_b.description: Long serving as the scout and exploration ship for the Argon fleet, the Discoverer saw little re-design or overhaul until the Jump Gate shutdown. The current model, an overall improvement on the model used before the shutdown, was designed in the Antigone Republic and made available to the Argon Federation as part of an ongoing technology exchange between the two allied factions.

ship_arg_s_trans_container_01_a.name: Courier Vanguard
ship_arg_s_trans_container_01_a.description: After years of outcry from many a trader about the lack of a small and speedy transporter, the up and coming ship manufacturer Jinko-Tekina have supplied both the Argon Federation and Antigone Memorial with the Courier-class s-ship, designed for transporting small numbers of valuable wares across a short distance in order to limit the risk of hijacking as well as to share the load of M- and L-sized transporters that make up the rest of the Argon merchant fleet.

ship_arg_s_trans_container_01_b.name: Courier Sentinel
ship_arg_s_trans_container_01_b.description: After years of outcry from many a trader about the lack of a small and speedy transporter, the up and coming ship manufacturer Jinko-Tekina have supplied both the Argon Federation and Antigone Memorial with the Courier-class s-ship, designed for transporting small numbers of valuable wares across a short distance in order to limit the risk of hijacking as well as to share the load of M- and L-sized transporters that make up the rest of the Argon merchant fleet.

ship_arg_s_trans_container_02_a.name: Callisto Vanguard
ship_arg_s_trans_container_02_a.description: While largely superseded by more modern courier designs, the Argon Callisto has a strange, cult attraction. In no area does this ship excel, and yet thousands of owners gather periodically at Hatikvah's Choice to show off their various paint jobs and module modifications.\n\nThe release of a Vanguard model did not make the ship materially more useful, however, Callisto aficionados do seem to appreciate it.

ship_arg_s_trans_container_02_b.name: Callisto Sentinel
ship_arg_s_trans_container_02_b.description: While largely superseded by more modern courier designs, the Argon Callisto has a strange, cult attraction. In no area does this ship excel, and yet thousands of owners gather periodically at Hatikvah's Choice to show off their various paint jobs and module modifications.\n\nThe release of a Sentinel variant is seen by some as evidence that the manufacturer has found a means of monetising the Callisto's enthusiastic fan base, rather than an attempt to build a performance spacecraft.

ship_arg_xl_builder_01_a.name: Mammoth Vanguard
ship_arg_xl_builder_01_a.description: With the method of building stations having changed numerous times since the beginning of the Jump Gate shutdown, many have questioned the necessity for a dedicated building vessel, but the Mammoth has continued to find purpose.\n\nUndergoing changes with every iteration of the station building method, the last iteration of the Mammoth saw it transformed into more of a mobile platform than a ship; becoming immobile when deployed to a station construction site so that construction drones can easily be ferried from the ship to the site and back again.

ship_arg_xl_builder_01_b.name: Mammoth Sentinel
ship_arg_xl_builder_01_b.description: With the method of building stations having changed numerous times since the beginning of the Jump Gate shutdown, many have questioned the necessity for a dedicated building vessel, but the Mammoth has continued to find purpose.\n\nUndergoing changes with every iteration of the station building method, the last iteration of the Mammoth saw it transformed into more of a mobile platform than a ship; becoming immobile when deployed to a station construction site so that construction drones can easily be ferried from the ship to the site and back again.

ship_arg_xl_carrier_01_a.name: Colossus Vanguard
ship_arg_xl_carrier_01_a.description: The final ship shared with the Argon Federation by the Antigone Republic as part of their ongoing technology exchange, the new-look Colossus-class carrier was initially designed as such so that it didn't use much-needed resources that were sorely lacking in Antigone Memorial during the Jump Gate shutdown.\n\nWith an array of medium and small docks and launch tubes, the Antigone Colossus is a significant improvement on other Colossus models, able to deploy ships to the battlefield at a much higher rate and collect and store them far more efficiently, at the cost of some of its previous firepower.

ship_arg_xl_carrier_01_b.name: Colossus Sentinel
ship_arg_xl_carrier_01_b.description: The final ship shared with the Argon Federation by the Antigone Republic as part of their ongoing technology exchange, the new-look Colossus-class carrier was initially designed as such so that it didn't use much-needed resources that were sorely lacking in Antigone Memorial during the Jump Gate shutdown.\n\nWith an array of medium and small docks and launch tubes, the Antigone Colossus is a significant improvement on other Colossus models, able to deploy ships to the battlefield at a much higher rate and collect and store them far more efficiently, at the cost of some of its previous firepower.

ship_arg_xl_resupplier_01_a.name: Nomad Vanguard
ship_arg_xl_resupplier_01_a.description: Very quickly developed during the course of the latest defence against the Xenon, the Nomad is effectively a mobile equipment dock, allowing combat ships to repair and restock and get back to the fight more quickly. This has greatly helped the efficiency of both the Argon Federation and Antigone Republic fleets, and has already begun to see clones created across both Teladi and Paranid space.\n\nThe ship is not self-sufficient, requiring a defensive escort not to be torn apart in combat. If it can be defended though, the Nomad can prove a devastating support ship.

ship_arg_xl_resupplier_01_b.name: Nomad Sentinel
ship_arg_xl_resupplier_01_b.description: Very quickly developed during the course of the latest defence against the Xenon, the Nomad is effectively a mobile equipment dock, allowing combat ships to repair and restock and get back to the fight more quickly. This has greatly helped the efficiency of both the Argon Federation and Antigone Republic fleets, and has already begun to see clones created across both Teladi and Paranid space.\n\nThe ship is not self-sufficient, requiring a defensive escort not to be torn apart in combat. If it can be defended though, the Nomad can prove a devastating support ship.

ship_arg_xs_police_01_a.name: Argon Station Security Vessel
ship_arg_xs_police_01_a.description: Argon Station Security Vessels police the vicinity of Argon installations, seeking out felons and those carrying contraband. While they are lightly armed, crossing them may compromise a captain's good standing with the authorities.

ship_gen_m_transdrone_container_01_a.name: Medium Drop Drone
ship_gen_m_transdrone_container_01_a.description: The Drop Drone is an essential system in terraforming operations, transporting the required surface-bound wares.\n\nThe Medium-sized model is an upgraded drone with additional capacity.

ship_gen_m_tugboat_01_a.name: Manticore
ship_gen_m_tugboat_01_a.description: With the advent of the Dark, Avarice was forced to rely on a fleet of stranded ships that had been taken by surprise by the Jump Gate shutdown. Despite the almost immediate collapse of the Avarice company, capable scientists and engineers soon took it upon themselves to stabilise the system and work towards sustainability. They first established a functioning wharf for repairs and replacement, and conducted early experiments into developing a recycling economy in anticipation of dwindling resources within the system. The regeneration of this post-shutdown economy was quickly curtailed by the first Tides, which destroyed most stations and ships in the system in 800 NT. However, a side-effect of the destructive solar event was the greatly increased energy output from solar panels, which allowed for a paradigm shift. The new Rakers economy emerging from Tidebreak, at the time the only station in Avarice, took advantage of this new abundance of energy. This, along with the use of local wrecks, enabled the rebuilding of a new, sustainable, closed-loop economy based on recycling, allowing them to further improve on previous ship and station module designs. Resettlement of Avarice began in 818 NT, when the Northriver Company introduced Protectyon and the associated Protectyon Shield Generators to safeguard stations from the Tide. A few years later, in 825 NT, the reconnection of Windfall gave the long-isolated Rakers the opportunity to trade with various Syndicate factions, but also exposed them to their piracy.\n\nWith the Jump Gate shutdown disconnecting Avarice the first Tug ship, a predecessor of the Manticore, was quickly developed by stranded Argon engineers to tug small ship wrecks to stations for further processing and make best use of the now very limited access to resources. With just one of those ships and their first version of the Scrap Processor and Scrap Recycler modules they ran a small enterprise with a high demand for energy and a slow output of Hull Parts and Claytronics. It was only after the first Tide destroyed most stations and ships in the system in 800 NT that their blueprints became the main pillar of Rakers economy and were further developed into the now widely used Manticore, utilising more powerful engines, and station modules. After messenger drones from Sacred Relic arrived, the people of Avarice themselves sent out messenger drones containing the blueprints to other disconnected systems, hoping to help those unfortunate enough to be stranded with no natural resources in reach. In doing this they created a local branch of the Alliance of the Word operating from Tidebreak. With the first Jump gate reconnection in 825 NT the Alliance of the Word would move to an own station in Windfall., Tug same as Tug)

ship_gen_s_fighter_01_a.name: Nodan Vanguard
ship_gen_s_fighter_01_a.description:
Perhaps the most interesting thing about the Nodan fighter is the lack of information available regarding its existence. It is only known to be available from the Alliance of the Word, and the organisation has remained tight-lipped as to the vessel's inception and design.

The design is somewhat quirky, with no clear antecedence related to other faction architecture. However, the Nodan has earned itself plaudits from committed dogfighters, based on its impressive speed, agility and deceleration.

For those seeking additional speed, the Nodan Vanguard model is available.

ship_gen_s_fighter_01_b.name: Nodan Sentinel
ship_gen_s_fighter_01_b.description:
Perhaps the most interesting thing about the Nodan fighter is the lack of information available regarding its existence. It is only known to be available from the Alliance of the Word, and the organisation has remained tight-lipped as to the vessel's inception and design.

The design is somewhat quirky, with no clear antecedence related to other faction architecture. However, the Nodan has earned itself plaudits from committed dogfighters, based on its impressive speed, agility and deceleration.

The Sentinel model provides the ship with a hardened superstructure.

ship_gen_s_fightingdrone_01_a.name: Defence Drone
ship_gen_s_fightingdrone_01_a.description: Advanced battlefield tactical command has been transformed by the evolution of Defence Drones. Once little more than cannon fodder, a drone swarm is now a formidable defensive capability.\n\nThe very best commanders are able to coordinate drone and non-drone strategies, adapting them to make best use of the strengths of each. Defence drone mastery is not an easy task, however; it is the mark of a top-flight tactician.

ship_gen_s_lasertower_01_a.name: Laser Tower Mk2
ship_gen_s_lasertower_01_a.description: Deployed from a compartment of a ship, the laser tower is a static combat unit used primarily in the defence of an area of objective. They use a simple targeting system to turn towards the enemy before firing. Though laser towers can target and hit small ships, they are most effective at medium range against medium or larger targets.

ship_gen_s_miningdrone_liquid_01_a.name: Gas Collector Drone
ship_gen_s_miningdrone_liquid_01_a.description: The Gas Collector Drone is an advanced drone system that greatly increases the efficiency of gaseous harvesting operations, particularly when used in large quantities.

ship_gen_s_miningdrone_solid_01_a.name: Mining Drone
ship_gen_s_miningdrone_solid_01_a.description: The humble Mining Drone is an essential asset at the heart of any primary resource-based business empire. Inexpensive, but highly vulnerable, the "termite" as it is colloquially referred to, is highly effective, particularly when deployed in large numbers.

ship_gen_s_transdrone_container_01_a.name: Small Drop Drone
ship_gen_s_transdrone_container_01_a.description: The Drop Drone is an essential system in terraforming operations, transporting the required surface-bound wares.

ship_gen_xs_buildingdrone_01_a.name: Building Drone
ship_gen_xs_buildingdrone_01_a.description: Affectionately named "termites", building drones are an essential component of station construction.\n\nAll races have moved to drone-based construction due to the scale of injury and loss of sentient life incurred through manual methods.

ship_gen_xs_cargodrone_empty_01_a.name: Cargo Drone
ship_gen_xs_cargodrone_empty_01_a.description: The Cargo Drone is a Teladi invention that expedites freight transfers and is ubiquitously popular among merchants across the known galaxy.

ship_gen_xs_lasertower_01_a.name: Laser Tower Mk1
ship_gen_xs_lasertower_01_a.description: Deployed from a compartment of a ship, the laser tower is a static combat unit used primarily in the defence of an area of objective. They use a simple targeting system to turn towards the enemy before firing. Though laser towers can target and hit small ships, they are most effective at medium range against medium or larger targets.

ship_gen_xs_repairdrone_01_a.name: Repair Drone
ship_gen_xs_repairdrone_01_a.description: The Repair Drone is an autonomous, self-propelled micro-vessel that is used for the repair of ship and station hulls.

ship_kha_m_fighter_01_a.name: Queen's Guard
ship_kha_m_fighter_01_a.description: Armed with the frighteningly accurate Kyon Emitter, the Kha'ak Queen's Guard most commonly attacks in swarm formation to devastating effect.\n\nThe pseudo-insectile nature of the Kha'ak gave rise to the theory that they are directly or indirectly controlled by a Queen. This, in turn, inspired the name given to this vessel. However, the theory is as yet unverified.

ship_kha_m_fighter_02_a.name: Hive Guard
ship_kha_m_fighter_02_a.description: The diabolical pyramids of the Kha'ak are a perpetual threat. The Hive Guard is a heavy fighter and one of the more disturbing Kha'ak ships that may appear on a pilot's scanner.

ship_kha_s_fighter_01_a.name: Protector
ship_kha_s_fighter_01_a.description: The appearance of the Kha'ak can trigger a sinking feeling in the stomach or stomachs of any pilot, however accomplished. These "space bugs", as they are often described, attack in mystifyingly geometric vessels, and have, thus far, rebuffed all attempts at communication.\n\nThis fighter has been dubbed the Protector and, like all Kha'ak ships, it is well-armed and trigger-happy.

ship_kha_s_fighter_02_a.name: Forager
ship_kha_s_fighter_02_a.description: The Kha'ak Forager is a lightning fast and highly manoeuvrable scout ship, with little accompanying weaponry. While notionally fragile, Commonwealth pilots report that the Forager is notoriously hard to catch and target.

ship_par_l_destroyer_01_a.name: Odysseus Vanguard
ship_par_l_destroyer_01_a.description:
The Paranid Odysseus is a highly regarded destroyer with an often consequential presence in large scale engagements.

The latest version's architect is the notoriously sensitive Olmanckabssit, who is reputed to fly into a rage at the slightest mention of the vessel's resemblance to a hair dryer.

The Odysseus Vanguard has enhanced speed.

ship_par_l_destroyer_01_b.name: Odysseus Sentinel
ship_par_l_destroyer_01_b.description:
The Paranid Odysseus is a highly regarded destroyer with an often consequential presence in large scale engagements.

The latest version's architect is the notoriously sensitive Olmanckabssit, who is reputed to fly into a rage at the slightest mention of the vessel's resemblance to a hair dryer.

The Sentinel model boasts greater resilience.

ship_par_l_destroyer_02_a.name: Odysseus E
ship_par_l_destroyer_02_a.description:
The Paranid Odysseus is a highly regarded destroyer with an often consequential presence in large scale engagements.

The E-model variation was introduced at a later date, and updated the superficial design to bring it up to par with Commonwealth standards that were established during the period of disconnection. The precursor version is slowly being phased out, but will remain available for interested third parties.

The Odysseus E-model prioritises hardpoints, however, it suffers from reduced storage capacity as a consequence.

ship_par_l_miner_liquid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Chthonios \ Vanguard
ship_par_l_miner_liquid_01_a.description: The Chthonios miner boasts impressive speed. The economics of running a large production empire require the optimisation of miners' speed versus cargo space. With sufficient speed, a constant stream of smaller deliveries of resources can keep mega-factories running more efficiently than if they are left waiting for larger shipments.\n\nThe Chthonios is tailored for just this style of "just-in-time" logistics management, and is available in models able to collect gases or minerals. The Vanguard variant adds even more speed.

ship_par_l_miner_liquid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Chthonios \ Sentinel
ship_par_l_miner_liquid_01_b.description: The Chthonios miner boasts impressive speed. The economics of running a large production empire require the optimisation of miners' speed versus cargo space. With sufficient speed, a constant stream of smaller deliveries of resources can keep mega-factories running more efficiently than if they are left waiting for larger shipments.\n\nThe Chthonios is tailored for just this style of "just-in-time" logistics management, and is available in models able to collect gases or minerals. The Sentinel variant enhances structural robustness in case miners encounter hostiles.

ship_par_l_miner_liquid_02_a.name: Chthonios E \
ship_par_l_miner_liquid_02_a.description:
The Chthonios miner boasts impressive speed. The economics of running a large production empire require the optimisation of miners' speed versus cargo space. With sufficient speed, a constant stream of smaller deliveries of resources can keep mega-factories running more efficiently than if they are left waiting for larger shipments.

The Chthonios is tailored for just this style of "just-in-time" logistics management, and is available in models able to collect gases or minerals.

The E-model variation was introduced at a later date, and updated the superficial design to bring it up to par with Commonwealth standards that were established during the period of disconnection. The precursor version is slowly being phased out, but will remain available for interested third parties.

ship_par_l_miner_solid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Chthonios \ Vanguard
ship_par_l_miner_solid_01_a.description: The Chthonios miner boasts impressive speed. The economics of running a large production empire require the optimisation of miners' speed versus cargo space. With sufficient speed, a constant stream of smaller deliveries of resources can keep mega-factories running more efficiently than if they are left waiting for larger shipments.\n\nThe Chthonios is tailored for just this style of "just-in-time" logistics management, and is available in models able to collect gases or minerals. The Vanguard variant adds even more speed.

ship_par_l_miner_solid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Chthonios \ Sentinel
ship_par_l_miner_solid_01_b.description: The Chthonios miner boasts impressive speed. The economics of running a large production empire require the optimisation of miners' speed versus cargo space. With sufficient speed, a constant stream of smaller deliveries of resources can keep mega-factories running more efficiently than if they are left waiting for larger shipments.\n\nThe Chthonios is tailored for just this style of "just-in-time" logistics management, and is available in models able to collect gases or minerals. The Sentinel variant enhances structural robustness in case miners encounter hostiles.

ship_par_l_miner_solid_02_a.name: Chthonios E \
ship_par_l_miner_solid_02_a.description:
The Chthonios miner boasts impressive speed. The economics of running a large production empire require the optimisation of miners' speed versus cargo space. With sufficient speed, a constant stream of smaller deliveries of resources can keep mega-factories running more efficiently than if they are left waiting for larger shipments.

The Chthonios is tailored for just this style of "just-in-time" logistics management, and is available in models able to collect gases or minerals.

The E-model variation was introduced at a later date, and updated the superficial design to bring it up to par with Commonwealth standards that were established during the period of disconnection. The precursor version is slowly being phased out, but will remain available for interested third parties.

ship_par_l_trans_container_01_a.name: Helios Vanguard
ship_par_l_trans_container_01_a.description:
The reasonably fast Helios freighter is a staple of Paranid logistics operations. While it cannot be said to be best-in-class on any single performance metric, it remains a sound choice overall.

The enduring popularity of this heavy freighter is believed to be founded on its sleek lines and attractive profile. Freighter captains are no rock stars, but the Helios does turn heads. It is not uncommon for youngsters to seek out berthing Helios vessels, begging for a ship tour.

The Vanguard model is the fastest ship in the Helios line.

ship_par_l_trans_container_01_b.name: Helios Sentinel
ship_par_l_trans_container_01_b.description:
The reasonably fast Helios freighter is a staple of Paranid logistics operations. While it cannot be said to be best-in-class on any single performance metric, it remains a sound choice overall.

The enduring popularity of this heavy freighter is believed to be founded on its sleek lines and attractive profile. Freighter captains are no rock stars, but the Helios does turn heads. It is not uncommon for youngsters to seek out berthing Helios vessels, begging for a ship tour.

The additional cargo space offered by the Helios Sentinel improves long term trading efficiency.

ship_par_l_trans_container_02_a.name: Selene Vanguard
ship_par_l_trans_container_02_a.description: The Paranid Selene is a modest heavy freighter lacking notable characteristics. If traders wish to move things, it does so without fanfare.\n\nThe Vanguard model was developed in an attempt to inspire some excitement around the Selene. Most commentators agree that this failed.

ship_par_l_trans_container_02_b.name: Selene Sentinel
ship_par_l_trans_container_02_b.description: The Paranid Selene is a modest heavy freighter lacking notable characteristics. If traders wish to move things, it does so without fanfare.\n\nThe Sentinel model raises the logistical performance of the Selene to levels that are generally considered to be adequate.

ship_par_l_trans_container_03_a.name: Helios E
ship_par_l_trans_container_03_a.description:
The reasonably fast Helios freighter is a staple of Paranid logistics operations. While it cannot be said to be best-in-class on any single performance metric, it remains a sound choice overall.

The enduring popularity of this heavy freighter is believed to be founded on its sleek lines and attractive profile. Freighter captains are no rock stars, but the Helios does turn heads. It is not uncommon for youngsters to seek out berthing Helios vessels, begging for a ship tour.

ship_par_m_corvette_01_a.name: Nemesis Vanguard
ship_par_m_corvette_01_a.description: The Paranid Nemesis is a highly sought-after corvette, boasting an attractive balance of speed, firepower and general versatility. The overall adaptability and build quality of the production line vessel ensure that the loadout options selected by owners can have a tangible impact on the tactical use-cases available.\n\nThe surprisingly fleet-footed base vessel can itself be optimised for speed by securing the Vanguard model.

ship_par_m_corvette_01_b.name: Nemesis Sentinel
ship_par_m_corvette_01_b.description: The Paranid Nemesis is a highly sought-after corvette, boasting an attractive balance of speed, firepower and general versatility. The overall adaptability and build quality of the production line vessel ensure that the loadout options selected by owners can have a tangible impact on the tactical use-cases available.\n\nThe Sentinel edition of the Nemesis offers additional resilience, which may be preferred by those operating in live fire environments.

ship_par_m_frigate_01_a.name: Gorgon Vanguard
ship_par_m_frigate_01_a.description:
The Gorgon is a high performance Paranid frigate, developed in response to the threat posed by the Split Dragon.

A popular escort vessel for capital ships, it can also provide the backbone for offensive fleets.

The Vanguard model is generally preferred for tactical offence.

ship_par_m_frigate_01_b.name: Gorgon Sentinel
ship_par_m_frigate_01_b.description:
The Gorgon is a high performance Paranid frigate, developed in response to the threat posed by the Split Dragon.

A popular escort vessel for capital ships, it can also provide the backbone for offensive fleets.

The Gorgon Sentinel is tailored for defensive operations, such as escort missions or station patrol.

ship_par_m_miner_liquid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Plutus \ Vanguard
ship_par_m_miner_liquid_01_a.description: The Paranid Plutus is a decidedly humble, medium-sized resource extractor, available in both mineral and gas extraction formats.\n\nThe Plutus is available in the Vanguard variation. This gas extractor is therefore marginally faster than its sister vessels.

ship_par_m_miner_liquid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Plutus \ Sentinel
ship_par_m_miner_liquid_01_b.description: The Paranid Plutus is a decidedly humble, medium-sized resource extractor, available in both mineral and gas extraction formats.\n\nThis gas collector boasts increased resource storage capacity in the Sentinel model.

ship_par_m_miner_solid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Plutus \ Vanguard
ship_par_m_miner_solid_01_a.description: The Paranid Plutus is a decidedly humble, medium-sized resource extractor, available in both mineral and gas extraction formats.\n\nThe asteroid mining Vanguard model's enhancements do little to negate the vessel's understated presence. The ship remains eminently forgettable.

ship_par_m_miner_solid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Plutus \ Sentinel
ship_par_m_miner_solid_01_b.description: The Paranid Plutus is a decidedly humble, medium-sized resource extractor, available in both mineral and gas extraction formats.\n\nThe mining variant is available in a Sentinel model, which provides a helpful increase in solid storage capacity.

ship_par_m_trans_container_01_a.name: Demeter Vanguard
ship_par_m_trans_container_01_a.description:
This light freighter has a dark reputation. While verifiable facts are absent, pilots talk in hushed voices of an early Demeter outing. An apparently wealthy, yet eccentric and reclusive, Teladi mogul commissioned a freelance Demeter Captain to transport him and his cargo from Ianamus Zura to Argon Prime.

Rumour has it that the ship was subsequently found floating in space in the Silent Witness system. The Demeter was found with no Captain, crew, customer or cargo; no sign of attack or damage, and with completely cleared ship logs. No-one has heard from any of them since.

The Demeter remains popular with freighter captains untroubled by superstition. The Vanguard offers enhanced offensive capability for operations in more challenging sectors.

ship_par_m_trans_container_01_b.name: Demeter Sentinel
ship_par_m_trans_container_01_b.description:
This light freighter has a dark reputation. While verifiable facts are absent, pilots talk in hushed voices of an early Demeter outing. An apparently wealthy, yet eccentric and reclusive, Teladi mogul commissioned a freelance Demeter Captain to transport him and his cargo from Ianamus Zura to Argon Prime.

Rumour has it that the ship was subsequently found floating in space in the Silent Witness system. The Demeter was found with no Captain, crew, customer or cargo; no sign of attack or damage, and with completely cleared ship logs. No-one has heard from any of them since.

The Demeter remains popular with freighter captains untroubled by superstition. The Sentinel model boasts additional resilience, tailored for commanders operating trade runs under fire.

ship_par_m_trans_container_02_a.name: Hermes Vanguard
ship_par_m_trans_container_02_a.description: The Hermes is a medium-sized Paranid-designed journeyman freighter with reasonable performance.\n\nWhile the Vanguard offers additional speed, even this model is widely considered to be unsuited to blockade running.

ship_par_m_trans_container_02_b.name: Hermes Sentinel
ship_par_m_trans_container_02_b.description: The Hermes is a medium-sized Paranid-designed journeyman freighter with reasonable performance.\n\nThe Sentinel model has improved cargo capacity and a somewhat hardened chassis.

ship_par_m_trans_container_03_a.name: Prometheus
ship_par_m_trans_container_03_a.description: The gradual Shutdown of the Jump Gates and the subsequent onset of the Dark shattered the shadowy organisation once known as the Duke's Buccaneers. Those that remained stalwart in their loyalty to the Pirate Duke had to rapidly adapt their operations to not be squashed under the heel of the newly emerging local authorities, or worse, fade into obscurity. Faced with the challenge to justify their further existence as an organisation, the majority of Buccaneer cells defaulted to the front they had already used for decades: the brutal, but dependable security outfit. Under this old and new guise, they acquired some renown transporting crucial personnel and wares for reconstruction and redevelopment. They also dealt in protection, corporate consulting, and other stunningly legal services. The support of well-equipped muscle proved useful for the leadership of the many societies that now struggled in isolation, and over the decades, the Buccaneers managed to refine their technology to suit the requirements of their new area of employment.\n\nThe Prometheus heavy transport is a relatively new addition to the arsenal of the Duke's Buccaneers, developed specifically to carry the lessons learned during the Dark into the era after the Realignment of the Jump Gates. Its hull is based on the Plutus, a well-known Paranid mining vessel. While earlier iterations of Buccaneer transport ships were often in fact civilian assets retrofitted for convenience, the design of the Prometheus is deliberate and insidious. Unless they were paying specific attention, any onlooker would simply see a mining ship, well-prepared for the dangers lurking at the edges of civilised space. On approach, such a hapless passerby or opportunistic brigand would soon realise that the inconspicuous hauler was in fact a well-armed pirate ship, perfectly equipped for a quick plunder. In one regard, the otherwise feigned identity as a deep space mining ship carries a sliver of truth, however: after a successful station raid, these ships tend to disappear towards the outskirts of a nearby sector, destination unknown.

ship_par_s_fighter_01_a.name: Perseus Vanguard
ship_par_s_fighter_01_a.description: A fast, small fighter, with respectable hardpoints, the Paranid Perseus has a reasonable following among fighter pilots and explorers alike. Recommended to young captains in search of their second ship.\n\nThe Perseus Vanguard opts for a focus on speed.

ship_par_s_fighter_01_b.name: Perseus Sentinel
ship_par_s_fighter_01_b.description: A fast, small fighter, with respectable hardpoints, the Paranid Perseus has a reasonable following among fighter pilots and explorers alike. Recommended to young captains in search of their second ship.\n\nThe Perseus Sentinel has additional superstructure reinforcement at the cost of speed.

ship_par_s_fighter_02_a.name: Theseus Vanguard
ship_par_s_fighter_02_a.description: The Paranid Theseus is a solid, all-round performer with deadly firepower, built upon a solid chassis. If it is lacking anywhere it is in speed, though there are many tactical deployments where this is not a major issue.\n\nThe Vanguard model aims to rectify the speed issue, though it is debateable whether this is achieved, or even necessary.

ship_par_s_fighter_02_b.name: Theseus Sentinel
ship_par_s_fighter_02_b.description: The Paranid Theseus is a solid, all-round performer with deadly firepower, built upon a solid chassis. If it is lacking anywhere it is in speed, though there are many tactical deployments where this is not a major issue.\n\nGiven the Theseus' relaxed pace, many captains opt for the Sentinel model, which improves the vessel's ability to withstand attack.

ship_par_s_heavyfighter_01_a.name: Ares
ship_par_s_heavyfighter_01_a.description: The Ares meets the much demanded need for a Paranid Heavy Fighter. Loaded with weapon hard points and shield generators, the Ares can both take and deliver a beating.

ship_par_s_scout_01_a.name: Pegasus Vanguard
ship_par_s_scout_01_a.description: The Paranid Pegasus scout is extraordinarily fast, ensuring the "Peggy's" enduring popularity with explorers in particular. Unfortunately, being followed by such a speedy vessel risks inviting a rear end collision, an eventuality known by pilots as being "peggied".\n\nIn response to demand from the most speed-addicted customers, the Pegasus was eventually released in a Vanguard model.

ship_par_s_scout_01_b.name: Pegasus Sentinel
ship_par_s_scout_01_b.description: The Paranid Pegasus scout is extraordinarily fast, ensuring the "Peggy's" enduring popularity with explorers in particular. Unfortunately, being followed by such a speedy vessel risks inviting a rear end collision, an eventuality known by pilots as being "peggied".\n\nThe Sentinel model marginally increases the scout's cargo space and resilience. However, these enhancements seem to be cursory rather than conferring any practical value.

ship_par_xl_builder_01_a.name: Heracles Vanguard
ship_par_xl_builder_01_a.description: The Paranid Heracles is an enormous station-building ship, and as such, is the foundation of an economic empire.\n\nThe Heracles Vanguard offers additional speed, though it remains somewhat pedestrian.

ship_par_xl_builder_01_b.name: Heracles Sentinel
ship_par_xl_builder_01_b.description: The Paranid Heracles is an enormous station-building ship, and as such, is the foundation of an economic empire.\n\nThe Sentinel model is a hardened version of the Heracles.

ship_par_xl_carrier_01_a.name: Zeus Vanguard
ship_par_xl_carrier_01_a.description: The Paranid Zeus is perhaps one of the fastest carriers available, making it an excellent choice as the keystone of any defensive or offensive fleet. The Zeus was designed specifically with this in mind, to allay growing Paranid concerns over the military growth of their many rivals.\n\nThe Zeus Vanguard is even faster, and is often the strategic choice in offensive operations.

ship_par_xl_carrier_01_b.name: Zeus Sentinel
ship_par_xl_carrier_01_b.description: The Paranid Zeus is perhaps one of the fastest carriers available, making it an excellent choice as the keystone of any defensive or offensive fleet. The Zeus was designed specifically with this in mind, to allay growing Paranid concerns over the military growth of their many rivals.\n\nThe Zeus is available in a Sentinel model, with a hardened superstructure for increased battle resilience.

ship_par_xl_carrier_02_a.name: Zeus E
ship_par_xl_carrier_02_a.description: The Paranid Zeus is perhaps one of the fastest carriers available, making it an excellent choice as the keystone of any defensive or offensive fleet. The Zeus was designed specifically with this in mind, to allay growing Paranid concerns over the military growth of their many rivals.\n\nThe E-model variation was introduced at a later date, and updated the superficial design to bring it up to par with Commonwealth standards that were established during the period of disconnection. The precursor version is slowly being phased out, but will remain available for interested third parties.

ship_par_xl_resupplier_01_a.name: Atlas Vanguard
ship_par_xl_resupplier_01_a.description: The Paranid Atlas is a large spaceship, specifically designed to repair and resupply fleets. This advanced vessel is equipped with cutting-edge robotics technology, and capacity for an ample supply of materials and resources. It can travel throughout space, effectively operating as a limited, but mobile, Equipment Dock.\n\nThe upgraded Atlas Vanguard is faster and more agile than its predecessor, supporting quicker and more efficient martial campaigns.

ship_par_xl_resupplier_01_b.name: Atlas Sentinel
ship_par_xl_resupplier_01_b.description: The Paranid Atlas is a large spaceship, specifically designed to repair and resupply fleets. This advanced vessel is equipped with cutting-edge robotics technology, and capacity for an ample supply of materials and resources. It can travel throughout space, effectively operating as a limited, but mobile, Equipment Dock.\n\nThe Atlas Sentinel is a variant with a reinforced hull for increased durability and protection. The hardened structure allows the Atlas Sentinel to operate in more hazardous environments, and increase its longevity.

ship_par_xl_resupplier_02_a.name: Atlas E
ship_par_xl_resupplier_02_a.description: The Paranid Atlas is a large spaceship, specifically designed to repair and resupply fleets. This advanced vessel is equipped with cutting-edge robotics technology, and capacity for an ample supply of materials and resources. It can travel throughout space, effectively operating as a limited, but mobile, Equipment Dock.\n\nThe E-model variation was introduced at a later date, and updated the superficial design to bring it up to par with Commonwealth standards that were established during the period of disconnection. The precursor version is slowly being phased out, but will remain available for interested third parties.

ship_par_xs_police_01_a.name: Paranid Station Security Vessel
ship_par_xs_police_01_a.description: The Paranid authorities are notoriously strict, particularly if a captain is not of their species. It is advisable to remain polite and compliant with regard to the Station Security Vessels policing Paranid space.

ship_tel_l_destroyer_01_a.name: Phoenix Vanguard
ship_tel_l_destroyer_01_a.description:
When the Teladi Company commissioned a redesign of the Phoenix destroyer, their goal wasn't to create an all-conquering super weapon. Instead, their focus was to build a robust capital ship able to withstand the rigours of battle long enough for reinforcements to arrive.

In this regard, commanders concede that, as a defensive platform, the designers succeeded. The Phoenix is built on a steadfast chassis. The designers are said to be particularly proud of an intelligently dispersed engine placement, where the previous model's cluster resembled an enticing invitation for torpedo targeting.

The Vanguard model marginally negates the Phoenix's lack of speed and agility.

ship_tel_l_destroyer_01_b.name: Phoenix Sentinel
ship_tel_l_destroyer_01_b.description:
When the Teladi Company commissioned a redesign of the Phoenix destroyer, their goal wasn't to create an all-conquering super weapon. Instead, their focus was to build a robust capital ship able to withstand the rigours of battle long enough for reinforcements to arrive.

In this regard, commanders concede that, as a defensive platform, the designers succeeded. The Phoenix is built on a steadfast chassis. The designers are said to be particularly proud of an intelligently dispersed engine placement, where the previous model's cluster resembled an enticing invitation for torpedo targeting.

The increased resilience afforded by the Sentinel model comes with a reduction in speed and agility that has caused some pilots to refer to the vessel as an asteroid with guns.

ship_tel_l_miner_liquid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Crane \ Vanguard
ship_tel_l_miner_liquid_01_a.description: The Teladi Crane is a large miner with truly impressive load carrying capacity. Fulfilling a major part of Teladi primary resource acquisition, the Crane is available in models optimised for either mineral or gas collection.\n\nThe Vanguard variant enhances the Crane's speed, which may benefit entrepreneurs who are mining resources far from where they are required.

ship_tel_l_miner_liquid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Crane \ Sentinel
ship_tel_l_miner_liquid_01_b.description: The Teladi Crane is a large miner with truly impressive load carrying capacity. Fulfilling a major part of Teladi primary resource acquisition, the Crane is available in models optimised for either mineral or gas collection.\n\nThe Sentinel variant enhances the Crane's cargo hold even further, though pilots should be aware that this may make them an attractive proposition for pirates.

ship_tel_l_miner_solid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Crane \ Vanguard
ship_tel_l_miner_solid_01_a.description: The Teladi Crane is a large miner with truly impressive load carrying capacity. Fulfilling a major part of Teladi primary resource acquisition, the Crane is available in models optimised for either mineral or gas collection.\n\nThe Vanguard variant enhances the Crane's speed, which may benefit entrepreneurs who are mining resources far from where they are required.

ship_tel_l_miner_solid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Crane \ Sentinel
ship_tel_l_miner_solid_01_b.description: The Teladi Crane is a large miner with truly impressive load carrying capacity. Fulfilling a major part of Teladi primary resource acquisition, the Crane is available in models optimised for either mineral or gas collection.\n\nThe Sentinel variant enhances the Crane's cargo hold even further, though pilots should be aware that this may make them an attractive proposition for pirates.

ship_tel_l_trans_container_01_a.name: Pelican Vanguard
ship_tel_l_trans_container_01_a.description: The Teladi Pelican is notable for its mediocrity as a freighter. It has taken to the level of an art form the capacity to be neither outstandingly good nor bad on any single metric. The single greatest mystery is why Teladi traders themselves use this ship, when there are many other more profitable options available.\n\nThe Vanguard model's increased speed manages to make the vessel even less profitable due to a reduction in cargo space.

ship_tel_l_trans_container_01_b.name: Pelican Sentinel
ship_tel_l_trans_container_01_b.description: The Teladi Pelican is notable for its mediocrity as a freighter. It has taken to the level of an art form the capacity to be neither outstandingly good nor bad on any single metric. The single greatest mystery is why Teladi traders themselves use this ship, when there are many other more profitable options available.\n\nRecognising the commercial weakness of the Pelican, the Sentinel model boasts increased cargo space, improving the ship's overall trade run profitability.

ship_tel_l_trans_container_02_a.name: Heron Vanguard
ship_tel_l_trans_container_02_a.description: The Teladi Company's Heron is a large freighter. It is noted for its somewhat relaxed pace, which is in keeping with mainstream Teladi design values.\n\nThe Vanguard model marginally improves the Heron's speed, but the vessel remains unsuited to express delivery.

ship_tel_l_trans_container_02_b.name: Heron Sentinel
ship_tel_l_trans_container_02_b.description: The Teladi Company's Heron is a large freighter. It is noted for its somewhat relaxed pace, which is in keeping with mainstream Teladi design values.\n\nThe Sentinel model is popular in military academies for use in remedial target practice.

ship_tel_m_bomber_01_a.name: Peregrine Vanguard
ship_tel_m_bomber_01_a.description: While originally designed as a bomber, the Teladi Peregrine has recently found popularity in the role of an escort ship. Its primary tactical advantage in this regard is its excellent turret coverage, which can be highly effective when appropriately armed.\n\nThe Vanguard model, with additional speed, was an attempt to retrofit the Peregrine to make it more suitable for its original intended role. Debate continues as to whether this was a success.

ship_tel_m_bomber_01_b.name: Peregrine Sentinel
ship_tel_m_bomber_01_b.description: While originally designed as a bomber, the Teladi Peregrine has recently found popularity in the role of an escort ship. Its primary tactical advantage in this regard is its excellent turret coverage, which can be highly effective when appropriately armed.\n\nThe Peregrine Sentinel leans into this novel escort role, offering increased superstructure resilience.

ship_tel_m_frigate_01_a.name: Osprey Vanguard
ship_tel_m_frigate_01_a.description: The Teladi Osprey is a surprisingly effective frigate with significant cargo capacity. On this basis, it can be used as a well-armed and speedy alternative to a standard freighter for trade runs where prejudice is anticipated.\n\nThe Vanguard model enhances speed, and as a consequence, the potential profitability of trading routes.

ship_tel_m_frigate_01_b.name: Osprey Sentinel
ship_tel_m_frigate_01_b.description: The Teladi Osprey is a surprisingly effective frigate with significant cargo capacity. On this basis, it can be used as a well-armed and speedy alternative to a standard freighter for trade runs where prejudice is anticipated.\n\nThe Sentinel variation compromises speed in favour of additional cargo space.

ship_tel_m_miner_liquid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Manorina \ Vanguard
ship_tel_m_miner_liquid_01_a.description: While ostensibly a resource harvester, some enterprising captains have repurposed the Teladi Manorina as a low-cost gunship, taking full advantage of its outstanding shielding capacity. Some even go as far as retaining the mining drill as a weapon, due to its extended range. Suspicions are occasionally expressed that this is a Teladi artifice for trading a weapon of war under civilian guise, avoiding the requirement for a military licence.\n\nThe Manorina can also be used to collect gas, and the Vanguard model adds a useful degree of speed.

ship_tel_m_miner_liquid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Manorina \ Sentinel
ship_tel_m_miner_liquid_01_b.description: While ostensibly a resource harvester, some enterprising captains have repurposed the Teladi Manorina as a low-cost gunship, taking full advantage of its outstanding shielding capacity. Some even go as far as retaining the mining drill as a weapon, due to its extended range. Suspicions are occasionally expressed that this is a Teladi artifice for trading a weapon of war under civilian guise, avoiding the requirement for a military licence.\n\nThe Manorina can also be used for harmless gas collection. The Sentinel model boasts increased storage capacity.

ship_tel_m_miner_solid_01_a.name: Vanguard)Manorina \ Vanguard
ship_tel_m_miner_solid_01_a.description: While ostensibly a resource harvester, some enterprising captains have repurposed the Teladi Manorina as a low-cost gunship, taking full advantage of its outstanding shielding capacity. Some even go as far as retaining the mining drill as a weapon, due to its extended range. Suspicions are occasionally expressed that this is a Teladi artifice for trading a weapon of war under civilian guise, avoiding the requirement for a military licence.\n\nThe Manorina can also be used to mine asteroids, and the Vanguard model adds a degree of speed in either use case.

ship_tel_m_miner_solid_01_b.name: Sentinel)Manorina \ Sentinel
